intro: Aeschynomene rehmannii var. leptobotrya, commonly known as slender pod aeschnomene, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, cylindrical pods contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
